Data Appendix A. Household Surveys (Census, ENIGH) We use data from 9 rounds of the Household Income and Expenditure Surveys (ENIGH), a nationally representative survey which spans the period 1984-2004. We also use data from the 10% samples of the Mexican Population Census of 1990 and 2000 available from the Census IPUMS. Unlike the ENIGH, statistical inferences using the larger Census samples are significant at the two-digit industry level (92 categories) and at the state level (32 states).
